modName: NotepadPlusPlus Papyrus Script Highlighting - Compiling - and Function Lists
summary: My own papyrus compile script, syntax highlighting and code folding layout, and an experimental function list regex snippet.
descriptionHtml:
This page is intended to be a resource and brief tutorial on how to use [url=https://notepad-plus-plus.org/]Notepad++[/url] to compile Papyrus scripts, enable syntax highlighting and code folding, and optionally Function List support.

To begin we start with downloading the required files (on the files tab of this page).
[list]
[*]For syntax highlighting and code folding: [color=#00ff00]dm_Zenburn_Papyrus[/color]
[*]For script compiling: [color=#00ff00]dm_NPPScriptCompile[/color]
[*]For function lists: [color=#00ff00]dm_NPPPapyrusFunctionList[/color]
[/list]
[color=#9900ff][size=5]Syntax Highlighting[/size][/color]
[spoiler]
This is probably the easiest part to set up and use. This color scheme is made to fit with the Notepad++ theme Zenburn.

[list=1]
[*]Extract the [color=#00ff00]dm_Zenburn_Papyrus [/color]archive to get the xml file.
[*]Open up Notepad++.
[*]Select the Language menu and goto the bottom and select the Define your language option.
[*]Click the import button and select the dm_Zenburn_Papyrus.xml you extracted from the archive.
[*]Close the language definition window.
[*]Close Notepad++ and restart it.
[*]You're done.
[/list]
If you wish to change the color coding you may do so safely now. This is how my profile will look.
[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/87715-0-1509862103.png[/img]

[color=#ff0000][size=4]Known Issues:[/size][/color]
[list]
[*]Multi line block comments using ;/   /;  do not highlight as expected.
[/list][/spoiler]

[color=#9900ff][size=5]Script Compiling from Notepad++[/size][/color]
[spoiler]
This section may need some configuration depending on how you have your code repository/ies setup.

[list=1]
[*]Extract the [color=#00ff00]dm_NPPScriptCompile[/color] archive to get the batch file.
[*]Copy or move the batch file to a location of your choice. I recommend the Papyrus Compiler folder under your game folder where the actual compiler is. Typically [Skyrim/Skyrim Special Edition/Fallout4]\Papyrus Compiler
[*]Make sure Notepad++ has the NppExec plugin installed. This is a default plugin I believe. If not you can use the plugin manager to get it.
[*]For many cases you will not need to edit the batch file. If you know you need additional import folders or you have the games installed anywhere other than "C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\..." then you will need to edit it. If you do then stop here a moment and I recommend reading the README I included in the archive as it has a long explanation of specifics. I'm not going to reiterate the whole thing here as it will be unnecessary for most users.
[*]If the batch file is good to go then load up a test script to compile. I recommend doing one of the default scripts as a test. Like "Ammo" since it's just a bare empty script. We just want to setup the compiler command line and make sure it runs.
[*]Goto the plugins menu, NppExec, and choose Execute. It may be worth making a note what the hotkey is to open it for future reference.
[*]Input the execution line to point to your compile script. Mine looks like this
[list]
[*]Skyrim:
"I:\Games\Steam Library\SteamApps\common\Skyrim\Papyrus Compiler\dm_NPPScriptCompile.bat" -sk "$(FILE_NAME)" "$(CURRENT_DIRECTORY)"[*]Skyrim Special Edition:
"I:\Games\Steam Library\SteamApps\common\Skyrim Special Edition\Papyrus Compiler\dm_NPPScriptCompile.bat" -skse "$(FILE_NAME)" "$(CURRENT_DIRECTORY)"[*]Fallout 4:
"I:\Games\Steam Library\SteamApps\common\Fallout 4\Papyrus Compiler\dm_NPPScriptCompile.bat" -fo4 "$(FILE_NAME)" "$(CURRENT_DIRECTORY)"[*][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/87715-1-1509859341.png[/img]
[/list]
[*]As my examples are written it will run the batch file specifying the game type, using the current file and outputting the compiled pex to the same folder as the input source.
[*]You may wish to use the save button to make the command line a preset for repeating the execution.
[*]When ready press OK and you will see it start executing.
[*]If all went well you will see something that looks like this
[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/87715-0-1509859341.png[/img]
[*]If you see any errors you may need to check your paths in the batch file to make sure they point to your game install folder. If not then you're ready to go.
[*]I recommend deleting the extraneous pex file you just compiled from the source folder. By design if you have it compile to the source folder which is the default for the command line I demonstrate, the game will not load it anyway.

[/list][/spoiler]

[color=#9900ff][size=5]Function Lists[/size][/color]
[spoiler]
This will take a bit more work as you have to use another editor and copy paste code into another file at a specific line.

[list=1]
[*]For this section you will need to have Notepad++ closed. So everywhere you need to open a file or edit something you will need to use another editor.
[*]This tutorial assumes you used the default installation options for Notepad++. If you chose not to use the %APPDATA% folder for storing settings then below you will need to use your install folder. This is typically only done when using Notepad++ on a portable USB drive.
[*]Backup your existing file at "%APPDATA%\Notepad++\functionList.xml" before editing in case something goes wrong.
[*]Extract the [color=#00ff00]dm_NPPPapyrusFunctionList [/color]archive to get the text files with the snippets.
[*]Open the dm_NPPPapyrusFunctionList_part1.txt with an editor that is not Notepad++.
[*]Now open the file for editing "%APPDATA%\Notepad++\functionList.xml"
[*]Navigate down to the <associationMap> section. It should be fairly near the top. You can insert the text anywhere in that section but I like to put it at the end to simplify the next part.
[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/87715-0-1510103637.png[/img]
[*]Open the dm_NPPPapyrusFunctionList_part2.txt with an editor that is not Notepad++.
[*]Navigate down to the line containing <parsers> it should be just under the <associationMap> section.
[*]Copy the entire text from dm_NPPPapyrusFunctionList.txt and insert directly under the <parsers> line.
[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/87715-0-1510104200.png[/img]
[*]Save the functionList.xml and close.
[*]Launch Notepad++ and open a script file to see if you get a proper function list
[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/87715-1-1509862103.png[/img]
[/list]
[/spoiler]
